name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So let's take a look at this in detail.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So in this random surfing model.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And any page would assume random surfer would choose the next page to visit.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So this is a small graph here.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _That's
column6: of course an oversimplification of the complicate it well. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: But let's say there are four documents here.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Right

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And let's assume that a random surfer or random walker can be any of these pages.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And then the random surfer could decide to just randomly jump into any page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Or follow a link and then visit the next page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So if the random server is at d1.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Then
column7: with some probability that random surfer will follow the links. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Now there two outlinks here.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: One is pointing to this D3.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: The other is pointing to D4.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So the random surfer could pick any of these two to reach e3 and d4.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _So the random surfer would decide to ignore the actual links

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _So
column8: it would be able to reach _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: any of the other pages even though there is no link directly from to that page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So this is the assume the randoms of.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Imagine a random server is really doing surfing like this

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: then we can ask the question.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: How likely on average the server would actually reach

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _a particular page d1

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: That's the average probability of visiting a particular page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And this probability is precisely what page rank computes.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So the page rank score of the document is the average probability

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: that the surfer visits a particular page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Now
column6: intuitively this will basically kept you the [INAUDIBLE] link account. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Why?

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Because if a page has a lot of in-links then

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _it would have a higher chance of being visited

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: opportunities of having the surfer to follow a link to come to this page.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And this is why

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: the random surfing model actually captures the idea of counting the in links.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Note that is also considers the indirect in links.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Why?

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Because if the pages that point to you have themselves a lot of in links

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: that would mean the random server would very likely reach one of them.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And therefore it increases the chance of visiting you.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So this is a nice way to capture both indirect and direct links.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _So mathematically
column6: how can we compute this problem enough to see that we need _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Sometimes you may also normalize the equation

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _that will give you a somewhat different form of the equation

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: but then the ranking of pages will not change.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: The results of this potential problem of zero out link problem.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _In that case if the page does not have any outlook

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _these pages will

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Basically
column6: the probability of reaching the next page from this _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: page will not sum to 1.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: Mainly because we have lost some probability mass when we assume that

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: there's some probability that the server will try to follow links but

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _then there's no link to follow

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And one possible solution is simply to use page specific damping factor and

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _that

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Basically that's to say
column6: how far do we want from zero for a page with no outlink. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: In that case the server would just have to

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: render them [INAUDIBLE] to another page instead of trying to follow the link.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: So there are many extensions of page rank.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: One extension is to do top-specific page rank.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Note that page rank doesn't really use the query format machine

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _So
column6: [INAUDIBLE] so we can make page rank

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _So
column7: in the topic specific page rank

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _we can simply assume when the surfer

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: The surfer is not going to randomly jump into any page on the web.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Instead
column7: to only those pages that are to a query. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _For example
column6: if the query is about sports then we could assume that when it's _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _doing random jumping
column6: it's going to randomly jump to a sports page. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: By doing this then we canbuy a PageRank to topic align with sports.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: And then if you know the current query is about sports then you can use this

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: specialized PageRank score to rank the options.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: That would be better than if you use a generic PageRank score.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: PageRank is also general algorithm that can be used in many other.

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _Locations for network analysis
column6: particular for example for social networks. _

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _We can imagine if you compute their PageRank scores for social network

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: _where a link might indicate friendship relation

name: 5 - 4 - 4.3 Link Analysis - Part 2 (00-17-30).srt
text: you'll get some meaningful scores for people.
